org.ngi

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ngi.Element
      • org.ngi.Node
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Assignment, BaseBoolean, BaseFunction, BaseMesh, BaseOperator, BaseParameters, BaseVectorTransform, BaseXYZTransform, Boolean, Color, For, FragmentSpec, If, IntersectionFor, LinearExtrude, MergeBlock, MergeExpression, Negative, Not, Number, OffsetLinear, OffsetRounded, Polygon, Polyhedron, Projection, Range2, Range3, Render, RotateExtrude, SCADOutput, SemiColon, TernaryIf, UserExpression, Variable, Vector

    public abstract class Node
extends Element
implements java.io.Serializable
    Base class for all Nodes. This handles all the management of Inputs and Outputs and Evaluation. Graphics functions are also managed in this class.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public Node(java.lang.String name,

        Constructs the base class. Initializes the Name, Bounds, and Description of the Node (passed to Element).
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the Node
        description - Description of the node - this is intended as a short help string.

      • allowOptionalInputs

        public boolean allowOptionalInputs()
        Always returns false unless an override is created in sub-class. Use this to allow adding optional inputs.
        Returns:
        True if optional inputs are allowed.

      • addOptionalInput

        public void addOptionalInput()
        Empty Method that is not normally used. Override this in sub-class to implement additional optional inputs.

      • isInvalidated

        public boolean isInvalidated()
        Get the invalidation state.
        Returns:
        True if the Node is invalidated (upstream has changed).

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(TerminalNodeList tlist,
                       int level)
        Invalidate the node and it's children
        Parameters:
        tlist - List or terminal nodes to evaluate.
        level - Current depth downstream.

      • evaluateUpstream

        public void evaluateUpstream()
        Recursive function looks at all Input Connections. If they are flagged as Invalidated, it walks upstream until no more invalidated nodes are found on that branch, and then evaluates that upstream Node. Nodes are evaluated on the walk back down, ensuring all upstream nodes are evaluated without any double evaluations.

      • evaluate

        public abstract boolean evaluate()
        Evaluate the Node. Override this method in the subclass to perform operation on the text.
        Returns:
        True if Node evaluates OK, false otherwise.
